node.title: At least $38b in JobKeeper went to companies where turnover did not fall sufficiently
node.alt: Hands remove cash from a wallet
node.description: Analysis by the federal Parliamentary Budget Office found that $38 billion in JobKeeper payments went to employers that did not suffer sustained downturns below threshold levels.
node.content:
["JobKeeper payments worth $38 billion went to employers that did not suffer sustained downturns below threshold levels, new data reveals.", "The wage subsidy program was the largest economic support in Australia's history, costing $89b\u00a0when it ended earlier this year.\u00a0", "However,\u00a0questions persist about the billions of dollars handed to companies that increased turnover or where turnover\u00a0did not fall by 30 per cent.\u00a0", "Fresh analysis by the federal Parliamentary Budget Office (PBO) found at least $38b\u00a0went to companies where turnover did not fall below thresholds during the quarter for which they claimed support.\u00a0", "\"Of course, JobKeeper was a good idea,\" federal Labor MP Andrew Leigh said.\u00a0", "\"But the way in which it was administered has led to some of the biggest waste in the nation's history.\"", "", "
Labor MP\u00a0Andrew Leigh is critical of the way the JobKeeper scheme was run.(ABC News: Ian Cutmore)
", "When announcing the wage subsidy program, the federal government said most companies would need to show a 30 per cent fall in turnover.\u00a0", "However, the rules were soon relaxed to allow employers to qualify based on an estimated reduction in turnover.\u00a0", "Once employers qualified \u2014\u00a0based on an actual downturn or a projection \u2014\u00a0they remained in the scheme for up to six months until late September, receiving $1,500 per eligible employee each fortnight.", "However, many firms did not suffer as much as feared, and $38b\u00a0of the $72b\u00a0examined by the independent PBO\u00a0went to companies where quarterly turnover did not fall below the thresholds.", "That represents 53 per cent of the taxpayer cash spend that was\u00a0examined.", "\"Every dollar paid out on JobKeeper needs to be paid by Australians, either in the form of higher taxes, lower services\u00a0or more debt,\" Dr Leigh said.", "", "
Treasurer Josh Frydenberg says JobKeeper \"saved lives and livelihoods\".(ABC News: Adam Kennedy)
", "Most businesses had to prove, or estimate, a 30 per cent turnover fall, while that figure\u00a0was 15 per cent for not-for-profits and 50 per cent for large companies.", "Federal Treasurer Josh Frydenberg said a recent report by his department showed businesses that received JobKeeper were heavily impacted by the pandemic.\u00a0", "\"It saved lives and livelihoods and supported more than four million Australians and a million businesses during the greatest economic shock since the Great Depression,\" Mr Frydenberg said.\u00a0", "
$1.3b\u00a0to\u00a0companies where turnover tripled
", "", "
The Federal Treasury building in Canberra.(ABC News: Kathleen Dyett)
", "The PBO has examined turnover during the quarter employers racked up JobKeeper and compared it to the same three-month period the year before.", "Its data revealed\u00a0that $1.3b\u00a0went to companies where turnover tripled during the quarter for which they claimed JobKeeper.\u00a0", "And a further $1.3b\u00a0was paid to companies that doubled their quarterly turnover.\u00a0", "\"We had firms that were doubling or tripling their revenues, and yet still getting money from Josh Frydenberg,\" Dr Leigh said.\u00a0", "\"At a time at which he should have been a frugal custodian of the nation's finances, he was spraying money around like a Formula One winner spraying champagne over the crowd.\"", "Overall, at least $19b\u00a0\u2014\u00a0or 27 per cent of payments examined by the PBO \u2014\u00a0went to companies that increased quarterly turnover while receiving the taxpayer support.\u00a0", "However, in a recent review, the Treasury department \u2014\u00a0which designed JobKeeper \u2014\u00a0argued that many companies that appear to have done better actually experienced downturns.\u00a0", "Treasury said turnover could\u00a0appear higher for firms that had grown over the previous year before COVID-19 struck, even though they suffered a hit to turnover.\u00a0", "The Treasurer says the PBO numbers \"overstated the value of payments flowing to businesses that had turnover increases\".\u00a0", "
Small business pays back JobKeeper
", "", "
James Ho returned all the JobKeeper money his business received.(ABC News)
", "There was no obligation for profitable JobKeeper recipients to repay taxpayer support, but some have decided to voluntarily return the money.\u00a0", "Hipcamp is an online marketplace for camping, connecting holidaymakers with landowners and holiday parks.\u00a0", "The company claimed JobKeeper early last year to help retain its two existing staff.\u00a0", "However, business boomed after regional travel reopened, and between July and September last year, turnover almost quadrupled compared to 2019.\u00a0", "\"It so happened that the pandemic, ironically enough, was actually a great thing for our company,\" Hipcamp Australia general manager James Ho said.\u00a0", "Mr Ho said it was \"only right\" for the company to repay the $51,000 in JobKeeper it ha received.\u00a0", "\"It was less of an economic decision \u2026\u00a0it was really more in the spirit of what we thought was the intent of the JobKeeper payments,\" he said.\u00a0", "
Where the money went\u00a0
", "", "
In the September quarter at least $18 billion went to companies that did not reach the turnover thresholds.\u00a0(ABC: Robyn Herron\u00a0)
", "Despite warnings mid-year that many JobKeeper firms were increasing their turnovers, the government decided not to change the scheme until late September.\u00a0", "The highest rate of JobKeeper being paid to companies that increased their turnovers, or did not meet thresholds, was recorded in the July \u2013 September period last year, where most states, apart from Victoria, largely remained open.\u00a0", "In that quarter, at least $18b\u00a0\u2014\u00a0about 58 per cent of the money analysed \u2014\u00a0went to companies that did not dip below\u00a0the turnover thresholds.\u00a0", "Eligibility was tightened in late September\u00a0and, again, in early January 2021, forcing companies to demonstrate an actual downturn to remain in the program.\u00a0", "Yet, at least $4b\u00a0was accrued in the December quarter by firms that did not fall below the thresholds between October and December.\u00a0", "And, between January and March, more than $2b\u00a0was racked up by companies that did not fall below the thresholds during that period.", "Companies that qualified for payments in the December or March quarters, based on previous downturns, did not need to also suffer falls within those\u00a0quarters.\u00a0", "There was no clawback mechanism for any period of JobKeeper, although the Australian Taxation Office (ATO) is pursuing a small fraction of companies that claimed despite being ineligible.", "
Scheme did its job, expert says\u00a0
", "", "
Treasury says tightening the JobKeeper rules sooner could have slowed the recovery.(ABC News: Kathleen Dyett)
", "In its review, the Treasury department said testing the turnovers of companies sooner risked slowing the recovery because some firms would reduce production to qualify.\u00a0", "\"If it had been designed differently \u2014\u00a0for example, if it was more tightly targeted or shorter in duration \u2014\u00a0this would have affected macroeconomic outcomes and the course of the recovery,\" Treasury department boss Steven Kennedy said last week.\u00a0", "University of New South Wales economics professor Richard Holden said the scheme did its job and it was the right call not to adjust JobKeeper for six months.\u00a0", "\"The idea was to provide certainty in a time of radical uncertainty,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"And the way you provide certainty is to make something simple, clear\u00a0and not subject to change within a certain timeframe.\u00a0", "The PBO's figures were obtained by\u00a0Labor MP Andrew Leigh and the PBO\u00a0obtained its data from the ATO, which administered the JobKeeper scheme.\u00a0", "The analysis excludes certain businesses, including those that did not record GST turnover in the corresponding quarter the previous year, and those that did not lodge a Business Activity Statement.\u00a0", "", "
